verses.verse: Bring back our captivity, O LORD, As the streams in the South.
(Job 8:21) Those who sow in tears Shall reap in joy.
He who continually goes forth weeping, Bearing seed for sowing, Shall doubtless come again with (Is. 35:10; 51:11; 61:7; Jer. 31:9; (Gal. 6:9)) rejoicing, Bringing his sheaves with him.

(Laboring and Prospering with the LORD) A Song of Ascents. Of Solomon. [1] Unless the LORD builds the house, They labor in vain who build it; Unless (Is. 61:3) the LORD guards the city, The watchman stays awake in vain.
It is vain for you to rise up early, To sit up late, To ((Ps. 121:3-5)) eat the bread of sorrows; For so He gives His beloved sleep.
Behold, ((Gen. 3:17, 19)) children are a heritage from the LORD, ((Gen. 33:5; Josh. 24:3, 4; Ps. 113:9)) The fruit of the womb is a (Deut. 7:13; 28:4; Is. 13:18) reward.
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, So are the children of oneâ€™s youth.
((Ps. 113:9)) Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them; (Ps. 128:2, 3) They shall not be ashamed, But shall speak with their enemies in the gate.
